author: Steve Lovell
title: UnicornHire Recruitment Platform
description: There are a number of areas of dissatisfaction and risk within the recruitment process, ranging from **Bias, Data/ID security and Ghosting**

assessments.note:
The proposal very effectively addresses the goal of bringing users and value to the network by creating a market for and onboarding users.

Job search is a stressful and tedious affair where personal information is often spread around multiple insecure websites, including SSN and critical PII. 

Integrating Cardano identity solutions and blockchain into the process would have a strong effect and bring a great deal of value to Cardano.

The proposal address one of the core area identified for blockchain application. Distributed trust setup. The proposal if successful can introduce blockchain to a large section of the job market. Verification of candidates and authentic mutual verification are major selling points for this proposal.

This dApps is a very good example of use case of the blockchain technology. And the idea itself is also very relevant and could bring a lot of attention to Cardano in a positive way. It also has a huge potential of impact, as it could be one of the largest platforms for online recruitment. All the benefits listed there are excellent and very well described and discussed. I work in a company that is nationally recognized as one of the most diverse in my country, my I still see many problems in this regard. I hope this kind of tool will help to address this in the near future.
No plan given thus unlikely to succeed. Currently this is an idea.

The team has a very strong background with over 50 combined years of experience in the fields necessary to give this project a strong chance of coming to market.

The plan presented addresses the multiple areas of focus over a 5 year period giving clear milestones for each, targeting early revenue sources to maximize chances of success.

The proposers have verified credentials and established a track record in the recruitment roles, including roles in the Blockchain industry. The primary proposer has worked in IOHK. The proposal will likely be getting the best attention.

The IT and HR experience of the team is very much aligned to the proposal. Although, it does not mentioned if any of the proposers has experience in developing blockchain applications, and does not mention recruiting someone to do that. It might be a part of the plan that is not included in the proposal as well. But since the proposers are heavily involved in the whole blockchain ecosystem, I believe that it won't be a problem. Some cost breakdown would also benefit the proposal (besides listing what would be done, but also how much each part would cost, to give a better understanding of the rationale behind 55k).
More details required on what is going to be done, milestones, risks, competitor analysis, front end platforms etc. As hiring is driven by the employer, how will it be marketed to them?

The team has a clear plan to provide audibility, including biweekly progress reports. 

The plan includes clear and achievable goals broken up into 5 annual phases of progress with specific milestones for measuring and auditing progress.

The proposal has included an exhaustive document outlining all the steps. There are many unassessed technical risks particularly in identity management and in credentials management including selective protection of sensitive personal information to recruiters to avoid bias. However, the proposal fit for carrying out a bold experiment.

There is a list of goals related to the so called Phase 1 of the development of this application, besides the overall roadmap looking at the next 5 years. The Phase 1 roadmap could have some deadlines included to improve the proposal's auditability. Some key metrics and KPIs could be included in order to evaluate the performance of the platform during Phase 1, even though it's going to be used only at CF. Also, the plan should be included in the proposal prior to the voting phase. It says that the plan would be shared later, but this compromises both the assessment of the proposal's feasibility and also it's auditability.

solution: We will implement gender bias removal through **Cardano**, ID sovereignty through **Atala** and candidate, company and offer contracts though **Plutus**
experience: Steve has around **8 years recruitment** including Blockchain (**IOHK and Emurgo**) and **18 years IT experience** (**Microsoft, Cisco, Accenture, HP**)
